frame.name: Fastener
frame.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Fastener</fen> is an artifact created to close a <fen>Container</fen> (e.g. coat, jar). Sometimes, the <fen>Container_portal</fen> rather than the <fen>Container</fen> is expressed.
<ex>The <fex name="cop">door</fex> <fex name="Fastener"><t>seal</t></fex> prevented air from getting in and the kids' screams from getting out.</ex>
<ex>She has an <fex name="Time_of_creation">antique</fex> <fex name="Material">ivory</fex> <fex name="Fastener"><t>button</t></fex> at the front and another vintage button on her apron.</ex>
<ex>NIST designed a <fex name="Type">high pressure</fex> <fex name="Fastener"><t>seal</t></fex> <fex name="Use">for the extension sleeve</fex> using a series of metal washers to load the window under pressure.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the item that is closed with the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
<ex>On Friday night, many men will simply elect to remove their tie and unbutton their top <fex name="con">shirt</fex> <t>button</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Fastener
FE.definition:
<def-root>The artifact created to close a <fen>Container</fen>.
<ex>Man, I have just bought the exact same belt <fex name="Fastener"><t>buckle</t></fex> and it won't open.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Container_portal
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the active zone of the container where the <fen>Fastener</fen> is located.
<ex>We couldn't close the <fex name="Container_portal">tent flap</fex> <t>zipper</t> and a lot of flies came in .</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifes the material from which the <fen>Fastener</fen> is made.
<ex>It has a matching fabric back strap with a <fex name="mat">metal</fex> <t>buckle</t> and grommet.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies a characteristic or description of the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
<ex>So, he?s standing there in the dirt road in his slacks and black dress shoes, gut over a <fex name="des">big</fex> <fex name="des">stupid</fex> <t>buckle</t> and his short sleeve shirt and his tie all messed up.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Fastener</fen> into existence.
<ex>We have 3 vintage <fex name="crea">Levi Strauss</fex> <t>buckles</t> for sale.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Fastener</fen> comes into existence.
<ex>This is a <fex name="tim">1960s</fex> <t>buckle</t> made by Diablo Silversmiths.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>The term used to refer to the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
<ex>Our popular <fex name="nam">Essex</fex> <t>buckle</t> is combined with this Laurel terminal to make an elegant set. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root>An indication of the subtype of the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
<ex>A flap portion is foldable over the <fex name="typ">Ziploc</fex> <t>seal</t>, secured in the closed position by a snap closure.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Fastener</fen> is made.
<ex>The unit has an adjustable diagonal <t>zipper</t> <fex name="use">for heat control</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: seal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device or substance used to join two things together or render something impervious.

lexUnit.name: button.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small disc or knob sewn on to a garment, either to fasten it by being pushed through a buttonhole or for decoration.

lexUnit.name: buckle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flat rectangular or oval frame with a hinged pin, used for joining the ends of a belt or strap.
